newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products end mixed ahead of 3-day weekend.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products end mixed ahead of 3-day weekend.

text.p: NWE oil products ended mixed on Friday ahead of a three-day weekend in the U.S. and U.K.

Fuel oil barges lost $1 to trade at $80/$81 under pressure from weak demand and competing supplies of cracked Russian fuel oil. Low sulphur cargoes were bid at $97 by one trader but no prompt supply was seen.
Gas oil premiums came under pressure as futures fell $1.00 a tonne on poor German demand.
Gasoline was firm on a plethora of bullish factors such as U.S. demand, local run cuts, an IOC tender and a dearth of cargo-sized parcels. Naphtha was easier in dull trade.
